Message.Text: A Boy Who Wants to be a Warrior
A Blacksmith on a Business Trip

You know, you look familiar... Oh! I remember now! You crossed Katumba Canyon over there a while back, didn't you? Haha! You'd better be careful. The canyon is safe, but there are tons of scary monsters on the other side./n

Have you ever seen a Young Lycurr? People who don't know better will try to pet them because they're cute little things, but that's a good way to get hurt. That's what happener to my son, which is why I volunteered to serve as a guard here. I don't want any more people to get hurt like my son./n
I'm so bored! They say peace is good, but I'm spending every day doing nothing. It feels like my body is getting rusty.../n

Oww... My stomach hurts! It must be the food that Ulaap gave me. I normally refuse it because I know something like this is bound to happen, but I was so hungry. I have hours to go until the next shift too... Oww... It feels like my intestines are being cut to pieces.../n
Have all your weapons and equipment ready. They're the only things that can save your life in a life-threatening situation./n
Welcome to the South Watch Tower! I'm the Watch Tower Chief Garfoyle. How may I help you?/n
What do you want? I'm in a bad mood as it is, and having a halfwit like you barging in like this isn't helping!/n

Did you just say the Spear of Light that pierced through the night sky? I saw it. It came out of the ground and shot up into the sky. It was an amazing sight, but because of it I couldn't get enough sleep. I don't care how amazing it is. I just want it to stop so I can get some sleep./n
There have been a lot of dangerous animals around lately. I'm worried because strange natural phenomena can be a sign of something big on the horizon./n
Take the road north from here and you'll see Karakunta. /nIf you happen to go to Karakunta, would you say hello to a kid named Taradel Stoneblade for me?/n

What should I do? I don't want to make him feel awkward by asking him for money, but I really need some. /nBut then, I can still get by, and it would be a bigger loss for me to make him uncomfortable... But I need the money to buy it.../n

Oh, I'm as busy as a bee!/nAnyway, lots of warriors came to this place right after finishing their training at Katumba Canyon, and I heard a lot of the ones who left the Tumbara Plains in search for something called the Lime. If you ask me they need to grow up./n
Listen! Do you hear the footsteps of Kashans?/n
Try not to make any sound! The enemy is near!/n
What unfathomable wrath! The angry soul is lamenting.../n
They keep attacking our supply carriages. We have to do something about it, and soon... Oh, excuse me. Can I help you?/n
(You can feel a powerful magic energy.)/n
(You can feel a powerful magic energy.)/n
(You can feel a powerful magic energy.)/n
Hi! You look like a Turga...?/n

I'm surveying this area so we can build a new town as the Khan ordered. Karakunta has become crowded as the population rose after the 3rd War of the Plains. I hope this place supplies us with enough drinking water, safety, and games.
(This is the grave of the late Renvolf Khan. It is oddly silent and serene.)/n
(This is a very sharp dagger. The hilt is quite old, but the blade is still very sharp.)/n
I can see your eyes are twinkling with high expectations for new adventures! We at the Adventurer Guild love promising young people like you./n
How do you like Kuniba? Our town might be small, but isn't it beautiful?/n

A life is but a day. Time seems to flow slowly, but it actually flows quickly. At my age, I think I can understand the flow, but I understood it a little too late, because it's about time for me to leave this life behind./nYou on the other hand, you're young. You have the precious gift of time, time to pursue your heart's desires. Think about how you'll spend the day as if it's the last day of your life so that when you lie down at night, you can say that you had a fun day./n
I came to Karakunta to learn about the legends and traditions of this place. If you hear something unusual, could you tell me about it? I'll pay you for your efforts./n
Have you seen a Lime Piece around here? I've heard that there are some people who want to buy them. If you get one, be sure to keep it./n
Welcome! I hope you have a fun trip!/n
Welcome! I'm the best cook in the Tumbara Plains!/n
Are you hurt? Show me your wound right now./n
Did you bring something new? Show it to me right now!/n
The Batus are strong and gentle, but it's hard to calm them down once they get mad. That's why you should always be calm when you're handling one./n
While the Tumbara Plains are a great place to live for most people, it's not a great place wood craftsmen like me because quality wood is hard to come by.
I won't stop you from climbing the Watch Tower, but be careful not to get in my way while I'm standing guard./n
So many of my colleagues have left for Karakunta. It looks like something big will happen since they're calling for us when we're all the way out here in Kuniba.
Don't cause any problems in the town./n
Welcome to Kuniba! If this is your first time here you should go greet to the elder./n
All clear! Huh? What are you doing here? Are you just a passer by? Don't startle me!/n
Kuniba is right behind there. Follow the road and go through the front gate./n
Did something happen? You're getting in my way. Step back, I need to stand guard./n
I'm glad to hear that. It should be another quiet day today./n
Kuniba is an important stronghold that's right in between Katumba Canyon and Karakunta. That's why we must stay on guard at all time./n
It's my job to sound the bell when something happens in the town, but I hope I don't ever to have do that./n
The bell we're protecting is used as an emergency alarm. Don't touch it./n
While it's hard to stand guard, it's even harder to maintain the bell. The moisture from the lake will make the bell rust in no time if we don't take care of it.
The lake is also the source of drinking water for Kuniba. It's my honor to guard this lake./n
Nothing is more beautiful than the glow in the sky reflected on the lake. I volunteered to serve as a guard here so I can see this spectacle./n
But there is also the possibility that our enemy can swim across the lake and invade the town in the middle of the night. That's why I must always be on guard./n

Tch! I was hoping to fight with the Keigers, but I was dispatched to the home front instead./nIf you're planning on going to Karakunta, tell Captain Kale at the Immigration Office about me! Tell him I want to fight!/n
Oh! I thought I just saw a big fish jump out the water! I did hear a rumor that there's a monster fish around here.../nCould you let me know if you see something out of ordinary?/n
I'm standing guard right now. Please don't talk to me while I'm working./n

Some Sweet Smelling Tea just arrived! Would you care to try it?/nI'm a Tea Ceremony Master. I'm proud of my work, because I turn some of the most common plants around us into Sweet Smelling Tea and serve it to people./n
Kuniba is a peaceful but boring place. I've asked my parents several times if we can move to Karakunta, but they like this place and they're so adamant about it./n
You there! Are you just starting your first adventure? You still might not know how to survive in the meadows yet, so try following the big roads for now!/n
This is Karakunta. This is the land of a great spirit. You'd best behave while you're here./n
Karakunta is right past the Door of Warriors. It's the Turga homeland./n
The biggest building next to me is the Tower of Fire Tradition. The Khan resides at the top./n
You can see the Tower of Fire Tradition anywhere in Karakunta. Well, anywhere with a clear view. It's not like you can see through objects in the way unless you're the Great Spirit./n
Can you see the building in front of us? It's the Tower of Fire Tradition./nYou should go to the top tier if you can./n
A friend of mine got really worried after seeing some strange light when he was out patrolling the Monkey Hill. He worries too much./n
Did you see the light over the Monkey Hill in the middle of the night?/nI hope it's not an ominous sign... I wish the Khan would do something about it./n
This is where the Khan resides./nMake sure your clothes are neat, and be respectful./n
What do you want from me? Go back to where you came from if you have no business here. This place isn't open to just anyone./n
My father served Renvolf Khan during the War of the Plains. I'll follow in my father's footsteps and protect the Khan myself. Unif Khan was a bit too brave for her own good./n
Who's there? Sorry. I though you were a filthy Keiger because your fur is such a mess./n
My little brother left here, saying that he'll become rich by collecting Lime Pieces in North Orta Continent. He's so foolish. What's the point of collecting such common items?/n
The Meadow has rough sandstorms sometimes, but I'm sure it will only make you stronger./n
Don't let your guard down in the Meadow. A moment of hesitation can cost you your life./n
Are you here to see Edun? The shrine is a sacred place, so behave yourself. Don't even run./n

You haven't seen Karakunta yet until you've seen the Tower of Fire Tradition. Well, okay, if you're in Karakunta you'd have a hard time finding a spot where you can't see the tower, but you know what I mean./n
My family has been protecting Karakunta for many generations, and my brother and I are no exception./n
Oh, I'm so bored. Bored as hell. Everyone is looking for the Lime, and I'm stuck here watching the same thing all day.../n
Are you here to see Orien Cultri? Go upstairs./n
The Plains are divided into two areas: the East Tumbara Plains and West Tumbara Plains. But both are ruled by one and only one./n
Did you pass through the shrine where Edun is? You must have seen my big sister then. What? Did you just say you saw ME? Oh, you must be mistaken. We're twin sisters you know./n
No matter how many of those cowardly Keigers are running around, the Tumbara Plains are the true homeland of the Turga people. We can't let them take whatever they want./n
What do you need? Repair? Or do you want to buy a new item? I happen to have many weapons and armors made of fine metal right now./n
My dream is to become one of the most famous blacksmiths in all of Orta Continent./n
While drinking tea is a tradition of the Muris Clan, it's also a great tradition of us Turgas. Let the aroma of the tea calm you./n
I've traveled many places, and learned a number of useful skills during my travels. I can teach you if you want./n
Taste! Great taste is the ultimate goal for any cook! And I'm the one who can help you to reach that level. So, what kind of ingredients do you need?/n
Magic is not cure-all. It merely gives you the power to find shortcuts to some of the processes./n
The stars told me that you were coming./n
The power of the amulets I sell will protect you and defeat your enemies!/n
The items you have stored here will be safe even after 10 more wars like the War of the Plains./n
No one can get through if the Stormwalkers stand in their way. We Stormwalkers will protect your money and items./n
Welcome! I'll protect your items with my life!/n
Hmm! Hmm! I think this musical interval will work. That's right. Put more emphasis here.../n
I have a very delicate tool that can carry your tense emotions through music./n
Do you want to learn how to make beautiful and functional items for which you need delicate craftsmanship? Oh boy... I see you already have a job. Concentrate on the path you have chosen./n
Look here! Buy the fish freshly caught from Kuniba Lake!/n
No one can get through if the Stormwalkers stand in their way. We Stormwalkers will protect your money and items./n
New fresh fruits are here! You won't believe how succulent these fruits are! Do you want to buy one?/n
Don't be afraid to die. Warriors who have accomplished much will have the blessings of running and hunting in the vast Sky Meadow with the Great Spirit./n
Did you come here because you're hurt? The body is the greatest asset for us. I'll tell you how to maintain your health so you can fight with all you've got when time comes./n
Welcome! I sell the ingredients you'll need for making all manner of medicines./n
Only those who understand the true value of daggers and poison deserve to learn my skills./n
Be careful! All my items are dangerous./n
How can you become friends with beasts? There is a way. Learn from me. I'll tell you the hidden secrets of nature./n
If you want to learn taming skills, my tools will help you./n
Do you need an item to make your life richer? Just say the word and I'll have it ready./n
Hey buddy! Did you say you want to learn true Meat Engineering? Good! I'll teach you! Let's put our heads together and get to work!/n
I'm Kale! Straighten up! Keep your chin high! Open your eyes wide! You must be ready to fight your enemy anytime, anywere!/n
He's the general. Try not to say anything useless and ask him politely./n
I won't forgive you if you're rude to the General!/n
Welcome! This place was built to give you the information you need. Ask me anything!/n
The Batus may be gentle, but they're not stupid. At least they're smart enough to refuse to have an unprepared rider on their backs. You'll need to have these tools ready if you want to ride one./n
You'll need my help if you're thinking about joining an organization./n
Isn't Karakunta a complicated place? The items I sell will help you./n
I'm Gjuva, and I'm in charge of the security of West Tumbara. Violence of any kind won't be tolerated while you're here./n
Are you ready to be trained to become a gladiator so you can join the vanguard in the war?/n
Do you want to learn how to control the Meadow and transform it into energy? Come see me when you're ready./n
I have only one wish! To kill every Kashan so not one single drop of their blood can return to this land!/n
What do you want from me?/n
Have you ever seen the Centaurus? They're a race of wise four-legged people./n
I'm Duncote Lionheart. I'm the Khan's aide. Since I'm only an aide, would you go tell the Khan if you have something to report?/n
What? Did you bring more paperwork or something? No? Good. It's so boring being the Khan. Isn't there anything interesting to do?/n
Hey! You! Do you need anything? Come take a look anyway! I'm sure you'll find something you need even if you don't think you do now!/n
Be polite. You're in front of the Khan./n
Hehehehe! This isn't me. This isn't me./n
Is my Grandma in Kuniba all right?/n
I need more dye to repair the fresco./nI really need the dye right now.../n
It's too dangerous to wander around the Meadow alone./n
Welcome, young adventurer! Are you looking for a job? Well, don't ask me! The person you want to see is the Adventurer Guildmaster!/n
You should always be on your guard for the sake of Karakunta./n
Is this your first time in Karakunta? Then you need to go to the Immigration Office./nIt's north of the front gate./n
This is the front gate of Karakunta. It's also called the Door of Warriors./n
Don't forget to practice your swordfighting skills. You don't want to be caught with a dull sword on the glorious day when we fight the Keigers to take back the Meadow./n
I saw smoke in the north not too far from here. It's kind of suspicious. You'd better be careful if you're going that way./n
Are you leaving the West Tumbara Plains in search of the Lime too? Then you should head Northwest. You'll be back. I know it./n
A while back, I went to the Monkey Hill to kill the Rinkees. There were so many of them I couldn't kill all of them no matter how hard I tried. I have no idea why there were so many of them./n
I've heard the rumor that carriages are being attacked in South Kuniba, and there are strange creatures roaming in the North. I don't know what's going on./n
The Kashans are a headache. They're good at hiding and they're fast. They're wicked traitors, so be careful when you see them in the Meadow./n
Have you seen a Muris named Eimbon by any chance?/nHis kind are so small that you could've missed him outright../n
The building in front of you is the Tower of Fire Tradition. Isn't that a great piece of work?/n
Did you just ask me what's outside the Meadow? I've never made that far myself, but there's the Duval Highland to the west. It's a land of humans, ruled by the Valkaras Kingdom./n

I'm worried because the Khan is still too young. The Lionhearts have never let us down, but I've heard rumors that the Khan is strong-headed and a bit whimsical. I'm so glad that the Khan's older brother Duncote is at her side as her aide./n
Have you ever listened to Soleil's songs? You can't say he's a great musician, but he is is a promising talent. His music is quite pleasing to the ear./n

You should be careful when you come across a plant that looks like a long whip. It's a Whippingsprout. You might think it would be of no threat because it's rooted to the ground, but it can end your life if you let your guard down./n
Kuga Thunderhand may be small, but he's a great berserker who can take anyone down when he's angry. I have high hopes for the warriors who're learning from him./n
There were not two, but three wars in the Plains. Tumbara is a land of blood and pain for us./n
All clear! What is this? I thought you were the Khan! You startled me./n
Unif Khan sometimes surprises me by coming down here. She must be bored. The Khan is too curious./n
Be careful. This is only the second floor, but it's still very high. Take one step wrong and Karakunta will be your grave./n
Why did your run all the way here from downstairs? I could hear your footsteps all the way. Be careful; the Khan is on the top floor./n
Behave yourself in the Tower of Fire Tradition. This place is an important symbol of Karakunta./n
The Khan? The Khan should be upstairs. The guards will throw you out the tower if you're rude to her. So be careful./n
It boils my blood to sit around in a place like this as a guard. Should I volunteer to work at the South Sentry Post next time?/n
Humph! I wasn't playing. I'm keeping watch over Karakunta and look out for the Keigers!/n
I've seen a number of Crokies with a strange name in South Kuniba. They always travel in threes... What were their names?/n
It's too high here. You can't work here if you're afraid of heights./n
I like working in this place because I can't doze off while working. It could mean the end of my life if I did!/n
One million thirty two... One million thirty three... Oh, I'm counting numbers because I'm bored. Don't worry me; hyst get on with your business./n
I haven't set foot outside Karakunta since I was put in charge of guarding Unif Khan. At this rate, I might forget what a Keiger looks like./n
I won't forgive anyone who's rude to the Khan!/n
Why won't my brother come back?
Do I look like I'm playing around?/nI'm staying here because this spot offers the best view of the front gate./n
I agree with the Khan. The East Tumbara Plains are our land, and we need to take back our territory. If we waste our time like this, we'll become complacent./n
Many Turgas have left this place in search for something called the Lime, and really, who can blame them? It's only natural for the young to seek such things./n

Who could he be? ...Oh, I'm sorry. I came across a brave and handsome warrior a while back, and I was trying to remember his name./nI have no idea who he is because the guards all wear the same uniform./n
I was told that you must go to Katumba Canyon before you can become a warrior. Have you ever been there?/n
Do Keigers have wide stripes on their bodies? Or are they spotted? I've asked a fellow guard several times, and now he won't even look at me when I ask him. But I'm dying to know!/n
What's the code?/nSorry, just kidding. We don't really use codes, so don't worry about it. I was just bored./n
Lime? Come to think of it, one time Soleil was playing his instrument near the market and he told me that rhyme is important... Are you talking about the same thing?/n
Senato is too naive. Don't pay too much attention to what he says./n
I heard that there are mushrooms that feed on blood. Do you really think there is such a thing? That sounds gross./n
Have you seen Fei? She's a human, but she's a trustworthy friend to us Turgas. She's a great mage too. Go see her if you're interested in sorcery./n
If you're interested in delicacies, go see my big brother Tasti. He's working on developing amazing new foods./n
I'm Tajaka. Listen, I don't think you're ready to leave this place just yet. Go back to where you came from and finish your mission./n
You can never come back once you leave this place. Are you ready?/n
Are you leaving? How I envy you. The outside world is in chaos because of some magical treasure called the Lime. Let us know when something happens, if you can./n
Do you want to go back to the canyon? I'm sorry, but I can't let you in./n
Follow the road behind me, and you'll see a Lion Statue. Pay your respect to our great ancestors./n
Turn right if you want to go into town, and turn left after that if you want to visit the Lion Statue./n
I can't stand all this waiting! When will we fight the Keigers? I want go kick some ass right now!/n
Are you from Katumba? There is a guard named Jambalchi there. I wonder if he's alright./n
What you see behind me is the Lion Statue. This is the resting place of the souls of the Great Warriors. Be sure to show proper respect./n
Are you tired? Then go get some rest in the tent next to me. Helping travelers is one of our duties./n

I went to Karakunta a little while back, and one of the funniest stories I've heard was about a treasure called Liem or Lime. They say it can make you immortal and make everyone kneel before you. I know it's an old myth and all, but don't you think it's a bit much?/n
The den of Bigs is in there. They're gentle, but they're very playful, and very strong despite their small size. You'd better not tarry if you don't have any business there./n
Follow the road and you'll see a Sentry Post. Why don't you go there? I've heard that the captain of the post is having a hard time because he's short of manpower./n

We at the South Watch Tower are in charge of keeping a vigil on the southern part of the West Tumbara Plains. It's less dangerous than the Central and Northern regions, but the work is harder here because we have to keep watch for longer hours./n
All we can see is dirt, plants, and animals. It's all too easy to let your guard down./n
Oh! Are you a newbie? Tch! Guess not. How long am I supposed to be the youngest one here?/nIt's already been six months!/n

My superiors are just too much. I know they're preparing for a war, but how are we supposed to keep watch if they take all the experienced warriors away? There are more and more dangerous creatures around here, and we need more guards./n
You'll see one of our soldiers at the Sentry Post in Kuniba. Try to help him as much as you can if you happen to do some work for him./n

I've seen rays of light shooting up into the sky from Monkey Hill. Could that be how the Keigers communicate? The captain of this post has been watching them, so I'm sure something will come out of it./n

The number of animals is rising, and they're becoming more violent than ever. This all started after that ray of light shot out from the southeast. Could it be a sign? I mean, they say the animals are very sensitive to any changes in nature./n
The Kashans have been getting closer to the Sentry Post lately. Finding strange footprints near the Sentry Post can make the heart of even a Turga like me skip a beat./n
It's been a while since experienced warriors have gone to Karakunta and new warriors have arrived. We're short of warriors to keep watch./n

Dang! Two of men were wounded already because of the Shaurpions. Their lives aren't in danger because we were able to treat them quicklt, but they say its poison is far more potent than that of a Shaura. You should be careful when traveling through this area./n
I saw the Sentry Captain submitted a request to the Adventurer Guild. The lack of manpower is always a problem./n
Go east from here and you'll see a town in ruins. The land is currently being occupied by the Kashan traitors. Try to avoid that area unless you have business there./n

Go east from here and you'll see the East Tumbara Plains, which was once our land. When the war finally breaks out, you and I will have to go east and recover our old territory. It won't be long now./n

I don't know about the Keigers, but you shouldn't underestimate the Kashans. Nothing is more difficult than fighting an enemy who's burning with fighting spirit. When you face the Kashans, fight bravely and vigilantly./n
Stay focused. This is the most dangerous part of the West Tumbara Plains./n
Our superiors told us that they're sending us new patrol equipment, but we're still waiting./n
We must defeat the Keigers and reclaim our Meadow!/n
You must be strong in order to survive in the Meadow./n
I manage all the tools in this area. Don't touch anything without permission!/n
Survival skills may seem easy to acquire, but it's actually difficult when you go deeper./n
Do you want to take a break? I'll help you./n
Welcome! I've prepared some Fresh Meat./n
I'm a guard for Kale. If you need to say anithing to him you can tell him yourself./n
You must be the crazy newbie who was dumb enough to sleep in front of Kale, right? He's leaving for Karakunta soon. Try to learn as much as you can from him before he departs./n
I heard the world is in chaos because of something called the Lime./nThey say it's a magical treasure that can grant any wish. Do you think we could drive the Keigers away with that power?/n
There's no way the Keigers will invade the canyon, but don't let your guard down./n
Stay focused. Don't you have a mission to complete?/n
Follow this road. It will lead you out to the canyon. But you'd better get permission first!/n
So, did you finish the training? Climb up behind me./n
It looks like you still have lots left to do. Focus!/n
I worked at the South Watch Tower before. I like working here much better because I have more free time, but I sometimes miss my friends at the South Watch Tower./n
Only those who have graduated from the Canyon can climb the road. If you still have more to learn, you can turn around and go back to where you came from./n
Working as a guard is hard, but sometimes it's fun to watch young Turga warriors training./n
Even the most common gravel is precious to the Turgas preparing for a battle./n

The Lion Statue was built in memory of the warriors who died during the Third War of the Plains. We won, but at great cost. Every drop of blood our warriors shed, was shed in hopes of creating a better future than this./n
The Lion Statue was built to commemorate the services of the warriors who died during the Third War of the Plains. Pay your respect for their sacrifices./n
The Katumbo Pups are causing too much trouble nowadays. They have desecrated the Lion Statue and even stolen the ritual food. They might do something worse if we don't teach them a lesson./n
Everything we learn in this place can help make us into true warriors./n
This Sentry Post was built for the purpose of protecting Kuniba from monsters like Lycurr. Protecting Kuniba is worth the effort./n
A Supply Carriage used to transport items./n
I'm on patrol duty right now. I don't have time to chat with you./n
I'm patrolling right now. Karakunta is a big place, so there's no telling when the next attack will come./n
We the Turgas are the true rulers of the Meadow. We can't hand control over to the Keigers./n
I've heard that there are White Keigers to the north./n

Master Olkubu over there became famous with his sandwich skill./nDo you know what Sandwich Skill is? It's a method used to forge two sheets of soft metal, and it allows for great heavy duty and armor that lasts./n

So you're the one who came here to take the test that every Turga must take! Since I already experienced it, I can tell you that you can pass the test without any trouble as long as you put your mind to it! Cheer up!/n
I see we've got another person who'll leave this canyon. Keep up the good work!/n
Hey there! Arent you the one who was gathering Black Veradium over there? It looked like hard work!/nWith your attitude I'm sure you can pass the test./n
I don't have to tell you anything, because I know you can do it without any help from me. Keep your spirit up and do your best!/n
May the Great Spirit be with you.../n
Don't be afraid. You can't do anything when you're afraid. Keep your up head high and be proud of yourself! That's the only way to do it if you're a true Turga!/n
When I stand guard here, I can see the training school where I was trained when I younger. The sight always brings back memories./n
I'll test you so I'll know if you're ready for the adventures that lie ahead./n
You remind me when I was young. There was a guard who watched me in this spot. Maybe he was feeling the same thing as I am now.../n
Oh, that's right! So you're the fighter who just graduated from the Katumba Canyon Training. Keep going downhill and you'll see Kuniba./n
I heard someone just graduated from Katumba Canyon with flying colors. Was that you?/n
I understand you passed the Warrior Test, but remember, that's only the beginning./n
This is the grave of the late Khan. If you want to take a look around, make sure you do it with respect./n
It would be a good idea to have a look around the late Khan's grave if you're Turga./n
Be silent! You shouldn't make too much noise here!/n
The late Khan's grave is right behind me. Since you're here, you should greet him./n
You need to focus while standing guard so no suspicious people can get in./n
Standing guard is a very tiring job, so please don't cause any trouble. Just pay homage to the late Khan and get out as quietly as you can./n

Why am I looking north? I can sense something suspicious moving in the north./nYou shouldn't let your guard down just because you can't see anything. You must always remember how much we lost in the past by failing to be vigilant./n
You look more ambitious than others./nHow can I tell? Your eyes told me. Your eyes look stronger and clearer than the others'./n
You can't be truly powerful just by training your body. Your heart is what really counts./n
Karakunta has a bigger market and it's a safer place, but I prefer the peace and quiet here./n
Things seem peaceful, but you can't just sit around and do nothing. Not if you remember what happened in this meadow in the past./n
I see you're training to become stronger, but you mustn't forget that you should be harsher on yourself than you are on others./n
It looks like my mother wants to send me to Katumba Canyon. I want to stay with my mother./n

My little sister is afraid of going to Katumba Canyon. I used to have to work myself half to death just to get by here./nBut then again, Katumba Canyon is also the place where I've learned how to deal with any dangerous situation with wisdom and courage. I'm sure my little sister will learn a great deal there./n
There are many Lycurrs around this place./nBe careful of them. They may look cute, but they have sharp, hidden claws!/n
We've been on alert because of frequent Lycurr attacks./n
Are you a newbie? Try to become a great warrior like me!/n
So many strange things are happening nowadays. I'm sure there is a reason why the Lycurrs became violent all of a sudden./n
This is the guard post. Who are you and what do you want?/n
I'm watching over the stable while my big brother is away fighting the Lycurrs./n

A few nights ago, I saw a gigantic pillar of light in the night sky! It was so beautiful that I lost track of time./nThe grownups say it's an ominous sign, but how can an ominous sign so beautiful?/nI'm sure something good will happen to our town!/n

Are you an adventurer? There are deadly venomous Shaurpions living around here. They're small, but their venom is so potent that it can paralyze you with just a little nip. I heard they live in deep puddles./n
Oh, where did it go?/nThings keep disappearing from the campsite. There's so few people around I don't think anyone would have taken it.../n

I'm sure there are many other important things to do before you can build a new town, but drinking water is the most important thing. I'm trying to find out if the old well is still potable. How about it? Do you want to taste it?/n

Did you follow the mysterious light here too?/nI don't know where the light came from, but I don't think it will pose a problem for building a new town. The Rinkees on the Monkey Hill are the real problem. They always show up in groups and play nasty tricks on us./n
It's important to take a break here and there even when you're fighting a battle. If you keep fighting without taking a break you'll faint from the fatigue./n
We're on our way to Karakunta right now. I'm sure there are many people who need our products there./n
Follow this road to Duval Highland./n
He's been training for over a month, saying that he became too comfortable./n
We should always keep ourselves in shape because there's no telling when the Keigers will attack./n
Follw this road to Khan's Cliff, a historical site of the Turgas./n
I was gazing at the fresco, and I began to really appreciate the countless heroes who died protecting this place./n
I can only marvel at the incredible skill of the painter who drew all this on the cliff./n
Our family is in charge of protecting Khan's Cliff. It was my father's job, and it is now mine./n
Khan's Cliff is a important historical place for the Turgas. The stories of those who have protected this land will be passed on to future generations./n
There are many difficulties in protecting this place, but that doesn't mean that we can neglect our duties./n
Keep your head down. It's dangerous here because it's the Keigers' den. I was patrolling this area to see what they're up to./n

You must be careful in choosing your weapon. You must think not only about the quality of the weapon, but also how you'll look when you use the weapon. Well, what I mean is that you also need to look cool enough to deceive those around you./n
I'm worried because the Khan is still too young and short-tempered. Duncote would have done a better job.../n
Hic! Where was I? What I mean is I don't like serving a female Khan! All the Khans before her were men!/n
Watch your mouth! Hush! What if someone hears you? Here you go. Drink quietly./n
Whew! My back is killing me! It's hard work drawing water from the well. I should go ask the Schier Clan if there are any tools for drawing water more easily./n
Please behave yourself in this sacred place./n
Edun, my teacher, was the one who connected us to the Great Spirit!/n
While guarding the front gate is important, guarding the exit that connects to the cave is more important. It's because you never know when Kashan or Keiger spies will sneak through here./n
Be careful. The enemy can show up at any moment. You should always be on your guard./n
The competition for medicinal herbs on the sides of a busy road is very high. That's why those of us with years of experience look for places where not many people go./n
I got nothing for days. It's never been like this... If I don't catch anything today, I should go back to town and get some rest./n
My teacher is drawing the history of Turgas on Khan's Cliff./nPlease don't bother my teacher by talking to him when he's doing something so important./n
My teacher can't repair the fresco because he ran out of dye./nI wonder what Nornar is doing?/n
You can feel a mysterious energy in Karakunta. I'm sure I can forget all my worries and gain peace of mind if I live in this place./n
Give me a room~ Hmm... So I guess singing a song won't cut it. Actually, I ran out of money.../n
I've heard that a Supply Carriage was attacked near Kuniba./n
I'm too scared to go out because people say that there are many dangerous beasts outside Karakunta./n
Oh! I don't know how long it's been since I last had a bite of smoked ribs!/nIt's so tender too! I'm certain this is made of Young Lycurr Meat!/n

I went to Kuniba with my husband a little while back, and it could have been a disaster! A chef named Ulaap offered us some strange food and we at it... Don't even ask. This is the first real meal I've had in days!/n
It's dangerous here because a battle can break out at any time. Please go somewhere safe./n
Get out of here! It's too dangerous! Just follow the road southeast to Karakunta./n

It's a lie! You're shorter than I am, and you look much younger too. How can you say that you're the same age as my dad? Grown ups like my dad have a low voice and big muscles, but your voice is like to mine and you don't even have any muscles. You're a liar!/n
Kid, it's because you Turgas are too big. We Pikin are an actual sensible size, but you guys just kept on growing./n

I have no idea how to use this!/nHuh? What am I talking about? What do you think I was talking about? I'm talking about the strange item called a Spiral or Sparkle./nThe Keeper gave me a manual to read, but I can't make heads or tails of it./nIn the good old days we had no problem living a good life without something like this! I don't need this stupid machine!/n

The spirits of our ancestors are with us everywhere. They exist in the vast land, in the cool breeze, and even in the animals of the meadow./nWhen you're in a difficult situation, clear your mind and listen closely. You'll be able to feel the spirits and gain strength from them, strength and courage to overcome any challenge./n
You must keep in mind that the war isn't over yet. You must be on your guard because the cowardly Kashans and Keigers will no doubt attack us again as soon as they have an opening./n
You can follow the Road of the Brave in front of the gate to the west to the Duval Highland. They say it's where humans called Valkyrians live./n
The water here is good for arthritis. My joints have been aching for a few years, and it gets worse when it rains. But my symptoms became much better after drinking the water here./n
This meadow is the only place where you can see the Tolbo Tree only./n
Black Veradium? There are bunch of it right behind us!/n
You can only obtain Katumbaraya Plants by using your Pick skill./n
We need to find the relics right away! We'll lose precious artifacts if we delay any longer!/n
What should I do? There are too many Katumbo Pups here!/n
Rain is the only companion of Arten Beastcrier!/n
I can't live a day without Art!/n
I'm the First-Aid Member who treats the injured people around this Sentry Post./n
The mysterious stone emits a hazy light./n
(This is a Worn Out Farming Tool.)/n
The sight of a young Turga makes me feel energetic!
Greetings! Are you the one who's seen the Green Jewel?/n
This is a Worn Out Dagger.
I'm Eran, the bravest of all Turgas!/nThere is nothing I won't do for my master!
Where is he? If we don't see him soon, especially in a place like this...
This is a Traveler Bag./nThe owner of the bag is nowhere to be seen.
If blood is spilt on the Tumbara Plains again, it will be because of me. I hope it doesn't come to that though.
Hehehehe! I almost starved to death in this desolate meadow! Hehehehe!
Life and death all depend on the Heaven...
He needs to regain his strength.
There's something strange about this stone.
I'll be rich when I find the Lime! Filthy, stinking rich!
Why are the relics always hidden in the middle of nowhere? I really wish they were in the middle of downtown or in my front yard!/nWhy did you have to make me come all the way here? Ugh!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Katumba Canyon Branch!
We're having fine weather today./nI hope you to have a great trip!
Hey! Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Kuniba Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Lakumba Campsite Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild South Watch Tower Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Central Watch Tower Branch.
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild North Watch Tower Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Mane Meadow Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Talunvara Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Lake Historical Site Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Katumbara Branch!
/nI'd rather die than live like this...
Are you hurt? I can help you./n
This place is closely guarded so we're less likely to be attacked by beasts, but I'm worried because many people still get hurt by accident./n
Weapons are nearly useless here, but there are still those who break hoes and axes. They're all newbies... That's why I have lots of work to do./n
Even a very small tool can be of great help to you depending on the situation. You might want to have at least one of these./n
You need to be careful from now on. Katumba Canyon is a safe place, but you've outgrown it, and there will always be lurking danger all around you from this point on./n
Please remember that we Greenleaf Healers are with you in your adventure. We'll help you whenever and however we can. All you have to do is ask./n
No matter how shabby your weapons and armor are, it would be of great help to us if you have them repaired whenever you can./n

I see you're a traveler. Do you want to take a break here? /n /nIf you can't craft items anymore because you did it too much, you can recover by resting at an inn. Of course, you'll need to pay for it. Money doesn't grow on trees after all./n
Nothing is more worthwhile than preparing hearty food with rare ingredients for those I love./nLearn Chef Skills and you'll also learn the joys of sharing.

A dotted skirt yesterday, sleek two-tone vest today, and pretty Rabbit headdress for tomorrow.../nA tailor is happiest when he sees the grayish streets come to life with his colorful clothes!/nAnd you can have this pleasure if you learn some skills from me.
It's very thrilling to sneak up behind your enemy in total darkness./nDo you want to learn that skill from me?
You need to rest after a while, and so do your weapons and armors. Let me take care of them for you./n

The sword and shield will become like a part of your body as you keep them at your side on a long adventure as a warrior. Every adventurer who embarks on an adventure around here takes my weapons and armors before they go! How about it?/nWill you learn the Blacksmith Skill from me then?
That your friends can use their swords on enemies without having to look over their shoulders is because they know we Clerics have their back./nWill you learn Healing Skills?
Hold this shining weapon and your enemies will run for their lives when they see you!/n
Why don't you buy one? It's like buying an insurance policy! It'll be too late to buy one after you get stabbed, you know./n
You need courage and strength if you want to survive in this tough world. And those are a must-have for any warrior./n
You need more than just weapons and armor before you go on a long adventure. Buy the items you will need for your adventure!/n
Beware of the animals in the Meadow. Some of them may look cute, but they're vicious enough to survive in this desolate land. They all have a trick or two to protect themselves./n
All living creatures in this world are equally precious. No one has the right to disregard the life of another./n
It's a bit ironic that we're saving lives in the Resting Place of the Dead./n
You should be careful while hammering in a solemn place like this./n
Although we can't resurrect the dead, we can help you stay alive. Come see us any time you want./n
Oh no! There's so much to do today! What happened to your equipment?/n
That your friends can use their swords on enemies without having to look over their shoulders is because they know we Clerics have their back./nWill you learn Healing Skills?

A Cleric's job is not limited to taking care of someone else. Depending on which road you take as a Cleric, you can either protect your friends or punish evildoers. I can help you if you're interested./n
The easier the principle may seem, the more complicated it is. The Vital Cube is very convenient, but also very sophisticated. It's simple to use though, so you don't have to worry too much./n
Take a look at this armor! Isn't it everything you were dreaming of all this time? Wear some of this armor on you adventure and everyone will envy you! Take your pick!/n
So many great new items just came in today! A merchant named Eimbon Tarachi brought me some great items. Take your pick!/n
I'm hammering not to refine metal, but to refine my soul. What have you brought to help me refine my soul?
They say a true warrior can be measured by his experience, but even a true warrior can't be powerless without his weapons./n

I see you're a traveler. Do you want to take a break here? /n /nIf you can't craft items anymore because you did it too much, you can recover by resting at an inn. Of course, you'll need to pay for it. Money doesn't grow on trees after all./n
It's true that there are not many types of tastes a human tongue can taste, but you can create countless different variations by simply combining them! That's what we chefs do./n
The steamy weather made me want to go back to the Louran Desert where my mouth will feel dry.
The fastest way to become the best warrior in the Orta Continent is to use your sword and shield as effectively as you can. I know that very skill./nDo you want to learn?
My father was a great warrior who died in the Third War of the Plains. He used to tell me: Always have your equipment clean and ready like your own body. Keep that in mind./n

The sword and shield will become like a part of your body as you keep them at your side on a long adventure as a warrior. Every adventurer who embarks on an adventure around here takes my weapons and armors before they go! How about it?/nWill you learn the Blacksmith Skill from me then?

A dotted skirt yesterday, sleek two-tone vest today, and pretty Rabbit Head decoration for tomorrow.../nA tailor is most happy he sees the grayish streets come to life with his colorful design clothes!/nAnd you can have this pleasure if you learn some skills from me.
Just like a needle and thread, I can't stop being a tailor. Choose what you need./n
Which road do you wan to take? Do you want to become a sword that can destroy the enemy? Or do you want to become a hard shield that will protect your friends?/n
Welcome! I have everything you need right here! Take a look at these healing potions that contain the strong life energy of the Meadow./n
Hey! Stop bothering me and ask someone else if you have any questions! Right now I'm working very hard to kill time!/n
If you want to learn more about becoming a professional thief, I'll help you. I'm sure you can focus on one of your many talents to really excel./n
Travel with cute little pets, and your tiring journey can become a pleasant one./n

Are you worried that won't have anything to wear because you have tailor's clothes when you're a chef? Come see me! If you have clothes that don't suit your job, I'll trade them for the clothes you need for your Trade Class!/n
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Kuniba Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Karakunta Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Karakunta Branch!
Welcome to Twin Clover Guild Kuniba Branch!
I have all the ingredients for making nutritious and delicious dishes!/n
Are you thirsty? How about a cold glass of water?/n
Ahem! Having a big bag means you have a big heart!

Magic may seem complicated and difficult, but it's actually a rather enjoyable process of reading the flow of the Mana in the air that's invisible to others./nDo you want me to teach you how to read the Mana Stream?

You can't have a healthy body without a healthy mind. Calming your mind by watching water boil after a hard day's work and smelling the sweet aroma of tea can help you train your mind./nYou can also have a healthy mind if you learn Tea Ceremony Master Skills.
Welcome to the Animal Farmyard! Woof!
This is a dangerous place where wild animals roam./n
Follow the road and you'll see the North Watch Tower on your left./nThat's where we were dispatched from./n
This is a sacred place. Please behave yourself./n
My relief from the North Watch Tower hasn't shown up yet. Are you going to that way by any chance? If you are, could you ask them about my relief?/n
You look more ambitious than others./nHow can I tell? Your eyes told me. Your eyes look stronger and clearer than the others'./n
I see you're training to become stronger, but you mustn't forget that you should be harsher on yourself than you are on others./n
I'm on my way to Duval Highland. Which way are you headed? Traveling around this area is hard because it's so huge!/n
I'm in charge of food and supplies for this post. It will be the end for us if the supplies are late.
We've been traveling the whole world in search of the relics left by our race.
I think it's too dangerous here. I think I should give up searching for relics here.
I'm not sure what we can do in such a poor environment like this. I'm just so tired.
I really hope we can get the materials we need delivered on time, but it looks like it's hard to do because it's too dangerous here.
I have successfully managed to run from Louran with a friend of mine who's standing behind me, but I have no idea what to do next.
I still can't believe we got away safely... I hope they don't catch us.
I'm so hungry I'm going insane!
Having sturdy equipment isn't everything. What's really important is how effective it is when you wear it.
If your clothes are too worn out or torn, bring them to me. I can patch them up for you.
Welcome to the Animal Farmyard! Woof!
My name is Ose! I've been told I'm quite attractive--you should probably be jealous.
You'll need your various Collection skills. They'll allow you to make money and get the materials you need in your everyday life./n

You can make different types tools if you have enough of the right materials. Wouldn't it be cool if you could use items you made yourself? If you happen to get a Rare Recipe you can also make special items that aren't sold in the stores./n
Have you gottent he hang of collecting coral? You'd better learn as much as you can from Brayson before you leave./n
Hey! You don't look like you're ready to leave yet! Go back to Coraleve Mine and learn the basic skills before you come see me again!/n

Youngsters nowadays are totally useless! There's nothing they can do right. All the coral they bring is damaged, and they run away when they think I'm going to make them work. To make things worse, they're all leaving here to look for something called the Lime./n
I wish Etwar could understand and trust me a little more. He was once a young man with dreams, but with all he's been through he's become jaded and suspicious./n
We'll become friends. What brings you to this forest?/n
Welcome to Green Coral! It's a small place, but you'll find everything you need here. Come see me if you have any problems!/n

Adventure is all well and good, but don't get careless. If you need help, ask for it! Unite with other young adventurers and share your skills./nIt's better to share a quest--and the spoils--than to simply turn it down because it's too dangerous to do alone. You need as much experience as you can get./n
You must think that we Seirens look strange, but to our eyes it's very odd to see someone standing on only two feet. It seems like it ought to be really tiring./n
I see Blue Coral is still a lively place. Are you here for me?/n
Coral is not an unlimited resource. We've been collecting and using coral as if it's a natural thing to do, but we must now find a way to save and protect it./n

I'm the Head Coral Ecologist, which means I'm in charge of surveying and studying the coral in the Old Coral Forest./nWhy am I doing this when there's coral all over the Blue Coral Forest?/nHaha! So many people have asked me that! We humans have been harvesting too much coral, and the state of the Old Coral Forest is proof. We always thought there was unlimited coral, but the coral forest is dying out. Our job is to find out the cause and protect this symbol of the Blue Coral Forest./n

Welcome to Violet's Blueberry Farm! How do you like my plump, juicy blueberries? I won't forgive you if you pick everything, but I will if you pick one or two. I know you can't help it because our blueberries are so delicious./n
I'm so sick and tired of those Balaur!/nAnd what are we doing here? We're not even soldiers! It's too dangerous here, so we should hide in the Blue Coral or Violet's Blueberry Farm!/n
I don't understand this. Why aren't we going after the Ancient Relics in the Blue Coral Forest? I think it's worthwhile to look into it./n

We're members of the Greenleaf, a private group of relief volunteers. We seek to live up to the teachings of Goddess Nysis. We'll show our love for everyone in this world and turn the Orta Continent into a warmer and more beautiful place./nWherever you are, come see us at our Greenleaf Branch if you get hurt during your journey./n
The wind is cold. I need to make sure the coral miners are healthy.
It's strange. People have been really tired lately. We Schiers aren't much for medicine, and we're only skilled in meat engineering! What should I do? We can't excavate unless our people recover!/n
The forest is Humbaba's home. The trees are my roof, and the rocks my walls./nHumbaba lives in the forest.
Oh, it's not like I can go back to the Coral Mine... I need to collect some coral.../n
I'm on the verge of a nervous breakdown because of the songs I hear every night.
My eyesight's been getting worse, and now I can't even tell people apart. I wish I had a pair of glasses that suited me better.../n
Neither humans nor kobolds treasure the coral. I want to show them that coral is a limited resource. If they keep picking everything in sight, nothing will be left in the end.../n
Hello all you beautiful people! Willy's ecstatic, there's never been this many stylish people in Blue Coral before./n
Do you want to ride this boat? Then you need to pay for it./n
I see you worked very hard swimming all the way here across the ocean. Did you get attacked by Marinebees? I, Rudivari, the Queen of Seirens, welcome you with a song of friendship!/n
Humans! Were you surprised? I'm sorry. Working here I rarely see anyone besides my colleagues. I was so glad to see you, so.../n

People usually think about precious treasures and powerful magic artifacts when they hear the word relic, but I'd like to say that these Slates are the real treasures./nWhat are these slates worth? Haha! I guess you don't know a thing about this. They're engraved with the history and knowledge of the Ancient Kingdom. How can you even compare the worth of the some shiny metal with the power to change the world?
The forest is... cozy... Mother... Come when you're tired.
This coral is coming back to life.
Those evil Kobold Gravediggers! We're not making any progress in the excavation because of them!/n
Is he alright? I knew I shouldn't have left him in the Red Coral... The place must have turned into a horrendous battlefield because of the Balaur.../n

Is he a mutant? Why are you sprouting in a place like this?/nOh my! You surprised me! Were you listening to me?/nWell this is embarrassing. I got into the habit of talking to the coral because all I do all day long is is study them./n
Welcome to Ruty's Puppet Shop! I have dolls for both decoration and battles! Hehe! Take your time and choose whichever you like!/n
I have no idea why the coral is withering when it was so lively before./n

Flies always go after delicious food, and this Historical Site Map is no different. The kobolds are after the most valuable relics, and it's driving me crazy!/nI heard they're attacking the Excavation Team now instead of finding the relics themselves. It must be because they figured it out that it's easier to rob the Excavation Team than to find things themselves./n
Oww! Those stupid Balaur hurt my leg!/n
If you're hurt or ill, don't hesitate to ask for our help. That's exactly what we do at Greenleaf./n
Hey there. Do you have time to answer my survey? Oh, was it a dry run again? People are so mean nowadays. At this rate I'd be better off paying an adventurer to do it for me./n
Hey! Stop bothering me and go away! Mind your own business./n
Don't look at me! I'm playing hide-and-seek right now. I really don't want to be caught!/n
It's a serious problem. We'll have a problem in our research project without it./n

Our new product No. 28 has outstanding performance and design. Buy now, and you'll save 998 Feathers! On top of that, we'll give you a coupon so you can buy New Product No. 26 at a discount price! How about it? Why don't you get one while it's on sale?/n
Greenleaf is a relief organization that was named after the Greenleaf, the humble ship that brought our ancestors to Blue Coral against all odds./n
Hi! Welcome to the Green Coral! I'm Econe, the PR Officer of the Green Coral!/n
We still have 5 more left... What should we do?
My heart is beating faster and I'm having hard time breathing. I'm also dizzy and my face is burning. What should I do? Am I going to die? Oh, what if my heart explodes?/n
This one doesn't look too bad, and neither does the other one...Oh, what should I do? Should I ask a passersby? But then I don't have the courage to do something like that.../n
In a moment a baby will be born to be loved by the forest. The baby will probably spend the rest of its life with the forest./n

That's right. I should make up my mind and tell her this time for sure.../nAre you a customer of mine? Thank you for visiting the Blue Coral Weapon Store! I have many great weapons here, so take your time looking around./n

(The ground is wet with some liquid with a strange odor./nIt's colorless, but the odor tells you that it's not water./nAll the coral growing on the wet ground has withered, and there are some empty medicine bottles on the ground.)/n
What brings you here? I don't have many visitors./nMe? I'm studying the coral here. That's my job./n
Did you say you're a traveler? Then be careful when you pass through the North Beach. The Tuto Clan has a town there called Tu Paka. They hate humans and attack on sight. Be careful./n
This is a serious problem! Ruty will kill me if I'm late!/n
Are you a traveler? It's dangerous here because of all the Balaur. You'd better hide in the Blue Coral where it's safer./n
My name is Han Soto! I try to serve the community with hot lunch! Do I sell lunch? No, I don't. I'm the cook for the Coral Ecologists./n
I'm so sick and tired of this! I'll make those fish pay for this!/n
This looks like a fine day to sail. The sea gulls are flying far away./nWhat brings you here?/n
What was that light over the shipwreck? I couldn't tell what it was because I was too far away, and it's not like I can go near the place.../n
Argh! I can't walk... I must kill those Balaur!/n
My name is Ruty Tiel./nCome to my Puppet Shop in Blue Coral if you have time.
I'm as busy as a bee! I have make a list of the all relics I collected today and check the excavator! Where did he go when there's so much to do?/n
We need to check out the Pillar of Light people have been talking about in North Emerald Hill, but I don't have anyone to do that for me./n

What are you doing? Don't just stand there; give me a hand! I'm glad we have so many blueberries to harvest, but I'm short of manpower! Eh? What about young people? They all left in search for something called the Lime. They're so immature!/n
I've heard that Violet is a distant descendant of Ortina. I'm sure what she does is right. I can bet on it. After all, she's a descendant of Ortina, who sailed the Greenleaf to this land of coral./n
It's not like we can remain dependent on coral. People say that we don't have to work so hard because we have all this coral, but it scares me to see the coral disappearing. What will it lead to?/n
This Coral Forest always makes me feel calm. Look at that Fresh Coral coming back to life. The power of life is truly amazing./n
Why do you think the coral is withering? It was emitting beautiful light not so long ago. It's getting better here, but the coral is still withering in the north./n
I'm sorry, but you can't go in there. I know you're curious, but please wait for now./n
Please go back to where you came from. You can't go in there./n
The coral has been in really bad shape lately. Just like Olivia said, we shouldn't rely on nature anymore. We humans must find a way to survive on our own./n
Old coral is worthless as a product. It's because the coral loses its natural beautiful light when it dies./n

Look at this beach. In the past it was filled with coral, but now there's nothing left. This is the result of harvesting and selling everything in sight, not knowing that we must return to nature as much as we take from it./n
Hey! I see you're a pretty good warrior! Why don't you fight with us? We can't just let the Balaur roam around like that!/n
The Balaur just won't listen. It's either they all die or we all die./n
Have you seen my husband by any chance? He was the first one to see the Balaur and told the townspeople about it, but I haven't been able to find him since we were attacked./n
Oh... Everyone... died. Even Millia who was living next door... And even Nit who loved me.../n
Why are the Balaur doing this? I don't think they're after money, or even the land. But they're still trying to kill us every chance they gey... Why are they doing this?/n
We can only hold the Balaur back for so long. They risk their lives to kill us. How are we supposed to stop them? There are just too many of them!/n

Stay strong! You're not supposed to be fainthearted! When they're done with this place, the Blue Coral will be the next. There won't be anywhere left to turn. Stop talking nonsense and pick up your weapons!/n
I spent my whole life building my house... I have no idea how I'm going to live now. Everything I had turned to ashes./n
You shouldn't let your guard down! You never know when those Balaur will turn up./n
This is Red Coral. A battle against the Balaur is taking place here. Go some place safe if you're not going to help us./n
This place is dangerous because the Balaur are still attacking. If you can't fight you'd better run!/n

We need to get out of here as soon as possible! Do you know where everyone went? Violet's Farm is nearby, but we won't be able to hold out when they come here. Wouldn't it be safer to head to Blue Coral?/n
I can't believe what happened to Red Coral. It was such a lively place... I can't forgive those Balaur./n
The Tuto Clan and others that threaten our safety won't even come near because we have it under heavy guard. You don't have to worry about anything while you're here./n
This bridge was built to last, so it won't collapse. I'm pretty sure it wouldn't even budge if 100 people got up there at the same time./n
I'm not supposed chit-chat while I'm working. I'm sorry, but please go ask someone else to escort you./n
I'm sorry, but please don't talk to me. My partner is a really uptight warrior, you see./n

Oh, I can't take this anymore! This is driving me crazy!/nWhat are you looking at? Haven't ever seen a hungry guard?/nJust put yourself in my shoes, and you'll know why I'm going nuts. I'm starving and the food in the street stalls smells great, but I can't leave for a snack because the captain would tear me a new one.../nThere's a proverb for this type of situation. What was it? The jewel coral in the picture... Or is it the jewel coral in the jungle?/n

I'll tell you a scary story. Near this place, there is a clan called the Pikins. They're cute little critters who often come here to sell their wares. They even talk cute, which makes them so persuasive when they say the things are on sale that I usually end up buying even when I had no intention of buying anything! Isn't that scary?/n
When the weather is clear, the scorching sun makes me tired, but when it rains, I hate how I get soaking wet. Standing guard right here while enduring all that isn't easy./n

Hoo boy. Those Matinas always make all kinds ludicrous demands. They want more interest, they want free drinks, they want an in-house massage... One of these days, I swear I'm going to snap./n/n/n/n/n(Use Shift key to share an item.)

Do you want to make a deposit? You came to the right place then. I'm the one in charge of opening deposit accounts. But if you came here to ask for withdrawal options, please go ask the person next to me./n
I'm in charge of withdrawal services. How much do you need? Oh, are you here just to take a look around? Haha! Look all you want and take your time./n
Oh, so many people came here today when I wanted to get some rest. Did something happen out there? I'm worried because so many people withdrew their money after the Lime incident./n
Why are the calculations wrong today? 243 Feathers, 721 Lant, 243 Feathers, 722 Lant, 243 Feathers 72... Oh, I'm wrong again. I shouldn't be like this... Oh, this is bad! I have to focus!/n

I've heard a rumor that coral prices will go down... Who would spread a rumor like that? Do you know? The more coral we pick, the less we'll have in the future. The price will go up rather than down because the Tutos are making the coral harder to get.
What is your business here? Loan? Deposit? Withdrawal?/n
Why are the calculations wrong today? 243 Feathers, 721 Lant, 243 Feathers, 722 Lant, 243 Feathers 72... Oh, I'm wrong again. I shouldn't be like this... Oh, this is bad! I have to focus!/n

Welcome! You must be here for our bread, aren't you? I can understand. There's nothing like the sweet smell of freshly baked bread when you're hungry! And the great texture of the hot bread that just melts in your mouth!/n
A friend of mine is supposed to make a delivery, but he's not here yet. I've got to start selling my products right now.../n

Polswan the Weapon Store Merchant buys items from us at low prices and turns around and sells them at much higher prices. We didn't know that. The next time he comes by I'll make him pay the full price./n
Welcome! This is the main Greenleaf building. You will see Greenleaf Healers wherever you go in the Orta Continent, so say hello to them when you see them./n

Have you ever been to the Ortina Stone Statue? Go there when you have the chance. It's a wonderful stone statue from which you can feel the great aspirations of the first Chief who discovered Blue Coral after sailing the vast ocean./n

Have you visited the Adventurer Guild? The guild is where townspeople go when they have a problem. If you want to make some money or become stronger, you can go ask a Guild Member. Go see them when you have the time./n
I just arrived in Blue Coral after traveling the Orta Continent. The Adventurer Guild feels like home to me./n

I've heard that someone named Loomba Cuplo designed this place. What kind of person was he? I wish I could meet him. They say he was a great adventurer, but he lived more than 1500 years ago. He was long dead before I was even born, so I'll never get a chance to meet him./n
Oddly, people don't seem to know that this building has a basement floor. Please take a look around. You might find something interesting./n
Lemme see. 23 swords and 14 daggers... And.../nHey you! Don't distract me! I lost count because of you!/nI have to start all over again!/n
A thief shouldn't let anyone know his location. You must be one with the darkness, so much so that not even you can feel your presence./n
In this world, there are many things that look ordinary when they're not. What kinds of things?/nYou'd better find out yourself. For example, take a look at the building behind me./n
Did you just say you want to create a guild? You came to the right place! I'm in charge of guild management. How can I help you?/n
Take a look at these Wingers. Don't they look cool? The silky fur, shining eyes, and lean body!/n
Hello! This is the Trade Guild. We try to secure a wide range of items by trading with merchants from other regions as much as we can./n
You need to talk to me if you want to hire a mercenary. Why? I'm the one who accepts, reviews, and approves applications./n

Today's income and expenditures are... Hmm... Oh! It's too complicated and it's giving me a headache! I can't stand this anymore! We're always short of manpower. It's a problem. We need an assistant who can help us!/n
I want to be a mercenary, but they make fun of me and say I'm too weak! Can I really become a mercenary?/n
I can't really trust the Matina Merchant Association because they're little bit too cunning. To be fair they do always keep their promises, but you'd better get the right promise out of them./n
I'd rather deal with the cute, down-to-earth and Pikin Merchants than the cunning Matina ones. The Pikins' sparkling eyes make me want to be nice to them for some reason.../n
Hey, listen to what I have to say. This is all I have. I'm serious! I'll give you all of this. Please let me ride on the boat! I'm begging you!/n
What would other customers think if I let you ride the boat when they had to pay? Stop asking me for favors. Money doesn't grow on trees!/n
Oh, my sales were 0.0000001 percent of what I made yesterday. What should I do to increase my sales?/n
If I was 10 years younger, I would have gotten on the ship to go somewhere far away. I heard there's a big city called Constania if you go south on the ship./n

I agreed to help them harvest blueberries at Violet's Farm, but I'm worried. A friend of mine who's worked at the farm told me that he had a really hard time working there because Violet was really picky, the Vixis around there destroyed the blueberries, and the blueberry juice dyed his fingernails blue./n
I'm a tailor, and if I get too fatigued from my work I can completely recover by resting at the inn! Do that if you're tired. I'm sure it'll help you a lot!/n
Cooking! You have to pour your heart and soul into the ingredients! If you're cooking just to make money, you're not a true cook!/n
Oh, I have a headache! I didn't get all the corals the Matina Merchant Association ordered! I must have everything ready by tomorrow.../n
This is a Coral Jewelry Shop where we cut and sell Jewel Coral, a specialty of Blue Coral. Although the raw coral is beautiful, it becomes more beautiful and shiny when we cut it./n
It's not a bad idea to learn tailoring skills if you want an elegant dress./n
It's every woman's dream to wear a beautiful dress to her wedding.
Nothing seems to work nowadays, so I came to the most famous astrologist in Blue Coral. I hope my luck is good.../n
My father set sail for another country a month ago and he's not back yet. I got worried so I spoke to the fortune teller, and he said my father is safe. That was a relief./n
My son went to the deep sea to pick coral. I hope he comes back soon. I haven't heard from him in days.../n
There is so much to do, and I don't think young people nowadays want to work because they're all going nuts over something called the Lime./nWhat the world is coming to?/n
Tell me, what do you think you'll find across the blue ocean?/n
I've been working here in this port for over 50 years. I'm old. I'd better let my successor take over so I can retire./n
You have to be patient if you want a fine sword.../nBut it's still frustrating to have to wait for my sword when the blacksmith told me that he'd have it ready for me yesterday!/n

I'm working here as an apprentice so I can become a fine blacksmith, but my master told me that I should learn how to read customers first. I don't understand how this is supposed help me become a better blacksmith./n
Hmm... I want to take a sword out of the furnace right now, but you can't make a good sword if you rush it. But then the old man over there is getting really impatient.../n

I want to run my business in Blue Coral, but they say everyone is leaving because the coral supply is declining./nI gave up on the idea of starting a business here, and I'm now thinking about going to another town./n
I used to sell coral jewels, but I can't seem to make any money because the price of raw coral has gone up. Now I'm selling something else... but I'm not sure how long I can keep doing this./n
You'll see Coral Beach if you go east from Blue Coral, and the next stop will be the Old Coral Forest./n
Be careful. There are many dangerous monsters outside Blue Coral./n
Do you want to make friends with wild beasts? If so you'd better remember what I'm about to tell you./n
The more powerful beast the you tame, the more damage it can inflict for you, but beasts like that are hard to handle./n
Although this is just a Sentry Post, we also handle warrior and gladiator business, so come inside if you have any questions about security./n
I'm seriously thinking about going on a journey to search for the Lime based on what I have learned so far./n
I'm searching through ancient records about the Goddess Nysis. I've heard that there's some connection to a race called the Ancient Elves./n
We're able to make living like it's nothing and smile at each other because the Goddess Nysis is looking after us. Never forget that./n
I'm studying with a friend of mine to become a good cleric so I can help others. What do you think about clerics?/n
My friend and I want to become a clerics, but I'm not sure if it's really for me. Should I try to become a tamer instead? Don't you think I would look better holding a whip rather than a holy book?/n
I need to eat! As the saying goes, The belly has no eyes. But before that, I'd better feed the animals./nI shouldn't let them starve when they're like family to me./n
I sometimes get this feeling that the beasts are looking at us with the most agonized eyes when we're eating, and it makes me really uncomfortable./n
Before you become a tamer you should level with the beasts first. Show your interest and love towards the beasts you handle./n
I don't think there are any sick children today, so I guess this is just another peaceful day./n
My back hurts because I've been crouching down to pick coral all day./nI'd better take a break so I can work harder next time./n
A long time ago there were many people my age in Blue Coral. We played hide-and-seek and had fun together. But now all my friends have left, and I'm the only one still here./n
Look at my reflection on the puddle! I'm so beautiful that even the most brutal Balaur will fall in love with me! Don't you agree?/n
Have you seen my friend near the puddle? Please watch out for her. She was almost killed by a Balaur once. Since then she's hasn't quite been right in the head./n
The weather is great today! Huh? Oh, are you searching for the Lime too? Do you think you can find it? Even my little brother wants to go out search for it, and my mom is trying to stop him.../n
Blue Coral is a quiet and cozy town. We should be okay here in Red Coral as long as the Balaur don't attack.

Silent Light Hill... I heard there's lots of beautiful jewel coral in Tu Mata, but also a large population of Tutos. If I was a little bit stronger, I'd wipe out the Tutos and take all the jewel coral.../nAm I being too dreamy?/n
My little sister Medina went north a few days ago, and she hasn't come home yet. Could she be trouble? I'm worried sick./n
My sons left Blue Coral to search for the Lime. At least my daughter is here with me so I'm not that lonely.../nBut I still feel like something is missing./n
There are less coral mining jobs now. I have no idea how I'm going to make living from now on. I can't go on like this. I'd better go see if I can get work with the Schier Excavation Group./n
My father has been feeling weak ever since my brothers went out to search for the Lime. I hope he recovers soon./n
People don't realize that the backyard garden is beautiful and a great place to rest. So, how do you like it?/n
Have you seen my wife? She's a big woman wearing green clothes... If you see my wife, please don't tell her that I'm here! Please! My life depends on it!/n
Go in there and you'll see Chief's official residence./n
This is the rear gate of the official residence. Go in the opposite direction and you'll see the front gate./n

You can change your destiny with your willpower./nFor instance, let's say you're destined to have a good life, but it won't be so if you don't do anything about it, hoping that something good will come even if you do nothing. By the same token, you can change a bad destiny into a good one if you try hard enough./n
Don't be deceived by the dolls' cute appearances. A puppeteer's dolls can be more powerful than a sharp sword or a great spell, so you should take heed./n
I heard there's a jungle in the Southern Continent where everything is huge. They say the trees and animals are so big that they'll make you feel like a midget./n
Could that mean there are giants too? Just the thought of it makes me shiver. We humans won't stand a chance against giants.../n
Recently we've had a bunch of adventurers searching for the Lime come visit our town.
Don't bother me while I'm working! You're distracting me!/n

Oh... The furnace is so hot that I'm getting dizzy. Should I get some rest first? No, I was told that a true blacksmith should be able to control the fire with his own will! I'd better give it a another try!/n
This is the Blue Coral Lighthouse. It's one of the most popular tourist sites in Blue Coral!/nThe building is currently under maintenance though, so no one is allowed in./n
Although climbing the Blue Coral Lighthouse is kind of hard because it's so tall, you'll feel great if you look at the ocean from the observatory on the roof!/n
Oh boy... I was thinking about climbing up the lighthouse when I'm not busy and enjoy the sight... But I can't because the door is locked. Maybe I should just go back home./n
We have a bird's eye view of the port from here. I'd better take the ship and leave after before too long. Better to set sail while the weather is nice./n
I was told that there's a big city called Blue Coral east of here. Then where is this West Tumbara Plain we're trying to get to?/n
Oh, this is strange. According to this map, Blue Coral is a city in the West Orta Continent... Isn't this North Orta Continent?/n

The firewood from the Blue Coral Forest is quite different that of the Bamboo Forest where we used to live. It's easier to light, and the fire is stronger!/nI should go back to where I got that firewood and get some more!/nThe campfire makes me feel warm and good inside./n
I was lucky to find a street stall with lots of food, so I brought some bread and meat. Let's share them after we get warm by the campfire./n
Who took my firewood? I had to work all day cutting that! I'll make him pay for what he did! I'll feed him to Ripper Shark, the man-eating shark of the Blue Coral Sea!/n
Do you want to take a break? I can help you./n

Don't all you have to do is hit the tree with an axe to cut it down. Leaving as few scars as you can and making it fall in the direction that's easier for you to carry are very important. Think about the angle you swing the axe./n
Sometimes you need high quality ore for making tools. There's some excellent ore just behind me. You should be able to gather them by using the Pick skill./n

The coral from the Coraleve Mine is an important resource for the humans here. That's why we stand guard like this every day. We wouldn't want some barbaric Tutos or other enemies to ruin this place, would we?/n
Don't you think Salem is a great guy? He's living proof that a man is at his best in middle age. Young men are so simple-minded and immature, I'd never want to date one./n
My relief is 30 minutes late, and he's nowhere to be seen. He's always late... I'm going to have to have a talk with that slacker./n
Follow this road and it will lead you to Green Coral./n
Coral is worth less and it's harder to process when it's scratched, so you'd better handle it very carefully./n
